intro: Schoenocaulon, commonly known as the star-of-Bethlehem, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of a single species, Schoenocaulon arabicum, which is native to the Mediterranean region. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of cultivation. Schoenocaulon is also valued for its ability to thrive in rocky or well-drained soils.
